I.
Heavy Industrial District, HI
1.
Purpose:
It is the purpose of the Heavy Industrial District to provide for
the orderly separation of intense industrial uses from commercial and
residential development. This separation will help to avoid having people
unnecessarily exposed to nuisance and pollution factors.
2.
Permitted Uses:
None
3.
Conditional Uses: All uses are conditional uses. The following uses are
permitted uses if the Town determines them not to be objectionable and if
the land owner complies with the various controls recommended by the
Planning Board.
Accessory Building Uses: Clearly incidental to a conditional use, which will
not create a hazard and cannot be occupied or rented and must meet
the requirements of this district.
Agricultural Processing (fruit, tobacco, grains, vegetables)
Apparel and Drapery Manufacturing
Wholesale Businesses

CELL (1, 1): 
1.
CELL (1, 2): 
Purpose :
The PUD District is established for the purpose if permitting
greater flexibility than would normally be allowed in a particular Residential
District, in the area, yard, space, height and density requirements for
construction and development of residential areas; and, therefore, to
promote and encourage more creative and imaginative site planning and
design than would be possible if such construction and development were in
strict compliance; with the requirements for the particular district. It is
further the purpose of this district to promote more economical and efficient
use of land while providing a harmonious variety of housing choices, a higher
level of urban amenities, and preservation of the natural scenic qualities of
open space.
CELL (2, 1): 
2.
CELL (2, 2): 
Permitted Uses: The PUD District may contain any use permitted in the
OAR, AF, R20, R15, R10, MFR, and C districts subject to location and
construction being on strict compliance with required plans and permits.

3.

CELL (6, 2): 
a.
Area Requirements - a gross land area of ten acres or more shall be
required in all PUD Districts.
CELL (7, 1): 
CELL (7, 2): 
b.
Density Limitation - The maximum residential density shall be 20
dwelling units for any given residential area. Subject to this limitation,
average development density shall be chosen prior to application for
rezoning and shall be designated on a Master Land Use Plan for the
project.
CELL (8, 1):

exceed 35 feet in height. No building shell be erected, reconstructed,
altered, or moved within thirty-five feet of the property line such
building faces. No building shall encroach upon the right-or-way of a
publicly maintained street, a proposed thoroughfare shown in an

Additional Thoroughfure District Requirements:
(5)
Building permits for all residential construction located is this district
must include a statement by the property owner acknowledging that the property is located in a
commercial use district
b)
An opeque buffer shall be constructed on ail four sides of trash
receptacles located in this district and must be of sufficient height to effectively shield the
receptable from an adjacent property view. Materials include solid wooden fence, metal fence
with vinity stats woven through the metal mesh, or other material approved by the Town.

Purpose :
The PUD District is established for the purpose if permitting
greater flexibility than would normally be allowed in a particular Residential
District, in the area, yard, space, height and density requirements for
construction and development of residential areas; and, therefore, to
promote and encourage more creative and imaginative site planning and

a.

CELL (7, 1): 
CELL (7, 2): 
b.
Density Limitation - The maximum residential density shall be 20
dwelling units for any given residential area. Subject to this limitation,
average development density shall be chosen prior to application for
rezoning and shall be designated on a Master Land Use Plan for the
project.
CELL (8, 1): 
CELL (8, 2): 
C.
Setback and Height - No building erected in any PUD District shall
exceed 35 feet in height. No building shell be erected, reconstructed,
altered, or moved within thirty-five feet of the property line such
building faces. No building shall encroach upon the right-or-way of a
publicly maintained street, a proposed thoroughfare shown in an

NEW PAGE 41
TOWN OF BOLIVIA
officially adopted thoroughfare plan, or a private vehicular or
pedestrian way in common ownership.
d.
Building Separation - Within a PUD District the minimum required
separation between buildings shall be determined by the relationship
between the height of adjacent buildings and the horizontal distance
between vertical projections of such adjacent buildings.
For the purpose of this section: a vertical projection is any part of any
exterior wall of a principal or accessory building, extending outward
from such exterior wall at an angle of less than 180 degrees, the
distance is equal to the distance, measured anywhere, between
imaginary lines drawn perpendicular to the ground and tangent to the
outermost points of vertical projections of adjacent buildings. The
minimum required separation between adjacent buildings is set out in
the following table.
MINIMUM REQUIRED SEPARATION
BETWEEN ADJACENT BUILDINGS
40

search_matches.text:
NEW PAGE 103
TOWN OF BOLIVIA
TOWN OF BOLMA
ORDINANCE AMENDMENT # 0003
Official Date of Amendment Change
Name of Ordinance Zoning
AMENDMENTS Zoning Ordinance Amendment #Z-0003
Amend Article II, section A (pg 13) by adding:
Thoroughfare District (TD)
Amend Article all (beginning at P9 27) by adding:
Section J. Thoroughfare District (TD)
1.
Purpose: If is the purpose of the Thoroughfare District to regulate the use of
and adjacent to major thoroughfares, ie., US 17 By-Pass in the Town of Bolivia and its extra-
territorial jurisdiction in a menner that will promote commercial activities particularly those
suitable to highway traffic, enhance overall property values, and protect residential
neighborhoods and the general health safely and welfare of the community.
2.
Permitted Uses: All general uses permitted in Commercial District 3
3.
Buffer: Buffers are required on property in the Thoroughtare District which abuts
property in a residential district or property occupied by any pre-existing residential use. Unless
excluded elsewhere in this ordinance, applications for a building permit on such property shall be
accompanied by a pist in compliance with Article VI of this ordinance and which shows the visual
buffer. The buffer shall consist of one of the following:
a)
A compact evergreen hedge or other type of evergreen follage
screening Minimum height and width for such buffer shall be five fest when planted
b)
A combined fence and shrubbery screen. the latter facing the residential
use Minimum height and width for such buffer shall be five feet high; and four feet wide when
planted
a)
An earthern berm @ minimum of three feet high and a maximum of five
feet high. with & minimum of three feet high by by three feel wide evergreen foliage. In the
event the berm and shrub option is used, the maximum slope on the berm sides shall be no
greater than one foot 10 one foot
The visual buffer shall be inspected by the Town Official enforcing zoning ordinances.
4.
Lighting: The lighting in thoroughture District must be designed in
such a way that it will have minimal effect on adjoining property Outside lighting shall be
constructed so that it will shine only upon the premises and shall not be directed 50 that it shines
directly onto adjoining property. This is to be accomplished by the proper selection. placement
and height of the fixtures. Signs may be Eluminated in compliance with Article XI of this
ordinances.
ordinance. The lighting plan shall be approved by the Town Official enforcing zoning
5.
Lot. Yard and Height Requirements
102

NEW PAGE 104
TOWN OF BOLIVIA
6.
Off Street Parking. Shall comply with the provisions contained In Article VI of
this ordinance
7.
Signs: Shall comply with the provisions contained in Article XI of this ordinance.
8.
Additional Thoroughfure District Requirements:
(5)
Building permits for all residential construction located is this district
must include a statement by the property owner acknowledging that the property is located in a
commercial use district
b)
An opeque buffer shall be constructed on ail four sides of trash
receptacles located in this district and must be of sufficient height to effectively shield the
receptable from an adjacent property view. Materials include solid wooden fence, metal fence
with vinity stats woven through the metal mesh, or other material approved by the Town.
Remaining pages will be re-numbered accordingly. beginning with page 27.
Article III, Section J (beginning of existing page 27) by changing:
J.
Planned Unit Development PUD
to:
K.
Planned Unit Development PUD
Article III, Section K (beginning at existing Page 35) by changing
K
Manufactured Home Overlay District (MHO District)
to:
L.
Manufactured Home Overlay District (MHO District)
Article III, Section L (begining at existing page 38) by changing:
L.
Manufactured Home Park (residential) MHP
to:
M.
Manufactured Home Park (residential) MHP
Article XI, Section 1: Delete Hern E and change item F to item E
Article XI: Add Section V SIGNS IN TD ZONES
A Permitted Signs
Identification signs One or more signs with a combined surface
area not exceeding 30 sq. ft.
Advertising signs; Advertising signs shall be no closer than
1200 feet apart on the same side of the thorough fare. Signs
with an advertising face no greater than 400 sq. ft. including
extensions and no higher than 50 feet, constructed of monopole
steel to withstand a loading factor of 35 pst are allowed Only

I.
Heavy Industrial District, HI
1.
Purpose:
It is the purpose of the Heavy Industrial District to provide for
the orderly separation of intense industrial uses from commercial and
residential development. This separation will help to avoid having people
unnecessarily exposed to nuisance and pollution factors.
2.
Permitted Uses:
None
3.
Conditional Uses: All uses are conditional uses. The following uses are
permitted uses if the Town determines them not to be objectionable and if
the land owner complies with the various controls recommended by the
Planning Board.
Accessory Building Uses: Clearly incidental to a conditional use, which will
not create a hazard and cannot be occupied or rented and must meet
the requirements of this district.
Agricultural Processing (fruit, tobacco, grains, vegetables)
Apparel and Drapery Manufacturing
Wholesale Businesses
